content: Which famous scientist developed the three laws of motion and the universal law of gravitation in his work "Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica"?

The famous scientist who developed the three laws of motion and the universal law of gravitation in his work "Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica" is Sir Isaac Newton. This groundbreaking work, published in 1687, laid the foundation for classical mechanics and had a profound impact on the scientific revolution.
